document_title: Wrist bursitis: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: viem-bao-hoat-dich-co-tay.json_1_Symptoms of synovitis of the wrist joint
subsection_content:
People with inflamed wrist synovial membrane will have some symptoms such as: (2)
Wrist pain: The patient feels pain, as if there is a heavy object pressing on the wrist joint. The pain increases if force is applied to the wrist.; Small lumps or swelling appear on the wrist with dark red skin; The wrist joint lacks flexibility and is difficult to move. Furthermore, when performing wrist rotation, the patient feels pain and discomfort; High fever accompanied by dizziness, lightheadedness, and nausea. This condition may be a sign of bursitis related to an infection.
